remarks: The kernel of the zero functional is the set of all vectors. (Contributed by NM, 4-Feb-2015.)
statement:
lkr0f2.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lkr0f2.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` W ) $.
lkr0f2.k $e |- K = ( LKer ` W ) $.
lkr0f2.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` W ) $.
lkr0f2.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` D ) $.
lkr0f2.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LMod ) $.
lkr0f2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
lkr0f2 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( K ` G ) = V <-> G = .0. ) ) $.
